Prescription for Coughing

To treat coughing:

  • Take 2 jin of Pinellia (Banxia), wash it in river water seven times.
  • Use 1 jin of alum, 4 liang each of cardamom, bulbus of Cimicifuga (Shengma), Amomum fruit (Suanshi), clove bark, and licorice.
  • Add 1 bottle of liquor and 15 slices of ginger.

Method:
Wash the Pinellia to remove its slippery coating. Roast the other ingredients until dry and grind them coarsely. Place the ginger slices and all the herbs with the Pinellia in a large mouth bottle, soaking them in liquor for 7 days in spring and summer, or 1 month in autumn and winter. Afterward, wash and dry the Pinellia, and do not use the other herbs. Take 2 to 3 pieces each time, without regard to timing.

Cough Remedy Song

The song goes: One liang of clear oil, two liang of honey, natural juice of Pinellia and ginger. Add Aster, Ephedra, and apricot kernels, along with dried stem of Xixin, and cook down until it is as black as lacquer. Take three liang before bed, and by morning, the cough will leave without a trace.

Qingzhou White Pills for Coughing

Preparation:

  • Soak a large amount of Pinellia in water seven times.
  • Clean and lightly roast 1 jin of Fuzi, along with Tianma and Chuanwu (slightly roasted and peeled).
  • Wash and lightly roast Nanshan as well as whole scorpions in equal parts.

Grind everything into a fine powder, mix with natural ginger juice, and boil into a dough-like consistency to form pills the size of a wutong seed.

Dosage: Take 10 to 20 pills after meals, with tea or warm water. If experiencing paralysis from wind, take with warm liquor, three doses daily. Regular use ensures freedom from wind phlegm and blockage. For children with convulsions, take 2 pills, dissolved in mint tea.[172p]

Ginseng Flower Paste
Song says: "For years, a cough has turned into an ailment; remove segments of ephedra and balloon flower. Stir-fry powdered herbs, apricot kernels, and thunbergia; add anemone root and fritillaria flowers. Equal parts of ginseng and black plum, grind and sift into powder without error; refine with honey and form into pills like large beads, dissolve one pill to eradicate roots."

Phoenix Marrow Soup
For treating cough, it can moisten the lungs.
One tael of pine nuts, ground; two taels of skinless walnut meat, ground; four taels of refined honey; mix and grind until smooth, take one qian after meals with boiling water.

Oil Drip Powder
For treating phlegm cough with facial swelling.
True clam powder, stir-fried on new tiles until red, fire poison emerges on the ground; a little indigo; mix with dilute saltwater, add a few drops of sesame oil to consume, and one will recover.

Black Gold Powder
For treating chronic cough and wheezing.
Forty-nine pig trotter black shells, rinsed; a large south star seed; half a tael of fritillaria flowers with pistils, ground; use a bottle, layer the pig trotter shells inside, cover with south star powder, close it, and seal with salt and red resin to fire it up until white smoke emerges, wait for it to cool, then mix with fritillaria powder, one part musk, and a little borneol to grind together. Take one qian after meals, boiled with white mulberry root soup to take down. For the young, use raw rhinoceros horn; for middle-aged, use half a tael of antelope horn powder to replace pig trotter shells.[173p]

Ning Sou Gao: It treats chronic cough with elevated Qi, heat in the chest, and phlegm-blood.

Tian Men Dong Wan: It treats cold in the lungs with exterior and interior phlegm, cough with loss of voice, a mouth like containing frost and snow, ceaseless cold phlegm, and throat obstruction, presenting as a situation similar to a plum pit, causing choking and blockage. Sheep Lung Soup
Used for cough with persistent day and night symptoms, feeling of suffocation, and lung damage causing blood in sputum.
Ingredients:

  • Six taels of calcined oyster, cassia heart, and fresh ginger
  • Five taels each of pinellia, rhizoma zhongru, powdered white quartz, five-flavored fruit, hundred部 root, fritillaria bulb, orange peel, and peeled peach kernel
  • Three taels each of magnolia bark, winter flower, and honey-fried licorice
  • One whole sheep lung, chopped

Preparation:
First, take the sheep lung and use one dou and three sheng of water to boil until it reduces to one dou. Remove the lung and add all the other ingredients, then boil again to reduce to three sheng, divided into four doses, taken three times a day and once at night. Avoid seaweed, mustard greens, sheep meat, and raw scallions.

Cough Clinic

Formula
Sang Bai Pi Decoction
Used for cough lasting for years that does not heal, with breathlessness and blood in sputum due to lung damage.
Ingredients:

  • Five he of mulberry white bark
  • Six taels each of ophiopogon, bitter apricot (blanched), and winter flower
  • Twelve fen each of poria, fritillaria bulb, cimicifuga, and scutellaria
  • Eight fen of peony and one whole white sheep lung, cut
  • One sheng each of honey and fresh rehmannia juice

Preparation:
Chop the ingredients, add one dou of water, and boil to yield three sheng. Strain out the dregs, then add the blanched apricot fat, rehmannia juice, and honey. Simmer on low heat until it boils like fish eyes, stirring continuously. Reduce to two sheng and filter through fine cloth. Take one he after each meal, three to four times a day. Adjust the dosage for the old and young as needed. Avoid raw, cold foods like oil, vinegar, fish, garlic, and wild mustard.[175p]

Lou Tang for Long-lasting Cough Relief:

  • One piece of Lou, remove the pulp, add one spoonful of clam powder, and stir-fry until yellow. Also stir-fry Aristolochia, Stephania, Kudzu root, remove shells from apricot kernels, stir-fry Glycyrrhiza, remove the heart from Fritillaria, and shred Ejiao. Combine with two handfuls of glutinous rice, stir-fry together, then separate the rice. Each ingredient should be two taels. Grind everything into fine powder. Each dose is three qian, with one cup of water, add half a spoon of honey, boil until seven parts are reduced, strain, and take warm at any time, three times a day and once at night.

Apricot Kernel Paste for Cough, Wheezing, and Blood in Saliva:

  • Two taels of apricot kernels soaked in soup, remove the shells and double kernels, stir-fry until slightly yellow, then grind into a paste. Three taels of lard, half a liter of white honey, two taels of Ejiao, crushed and stir-fried until yellow into powder. One cup of fresh ginger juice, two taels of Perilla seeds, stir-fried lightly and ground into paste. Mix these six ingredients in a silver pot, and simmer on low heat until it becomes a paste. Each dose is one spoonful at any time, diluted with warm congee, taken four to five times a day.

Huangqi Powder for Cough and Blood in Saliva:

  • Huangqi, glutinous rice, and stir-fried Ejiao pearls, each five qian. Grind into fine powder. Each dose is two qian, taken at any time, mixed with rice soup.[176p]

Tianmen Dong Pill: Treats lung congestion and heat, with cough and thick sputum. Ingredients: 1.5 taels of Tianmen Dong (Skullcap), heart removed and roasted; assorted ingredients including Baihe (lily), Qianhu (Fritillaria), Bei Mu (Fritillaria), Ban Xia (Pinellia), Chuanbei (tangerine peel) and others, each treated in specific ways. Grind the above into a fine powder, mix with honey, and roll into pills the size of a wutong seed. Take 20 pills each time, not limited to specific times, with fresh ginger decoction, three times daily.

Ningqi Decoction: Treats blockage of lung qi, heavy cough with dry throat and sticky phlegm, causing insomnia. Ingredients: 2.5 taels of millet husks, honey processed; Chenpi (aged tangerine peel) without white parts; Sangpi (mulberry bark) roasted; Chuanbei, Zisu leaves, Banxia with ginger, Tianlingzi, Wumeizi, Ziwun, and peeled, roasted almonds, each in specified amounts. Grind the ingredients, take 5 qian, add to a large cup of water with 7 slices of ginger, decoct until 6 minutes, strain, and drink warm after meals.

Another formula: Adjusts lung function, stops cough, regulates qi, and reduces phlegm. Suitable for those who can't catch their breath after coughing. In a密室 (secret chamber), like burning incense, smoke rises and can be drawn in through a pen tube to swallow it. Or, when burning incense in a sitting or lying position, it is effective even without inhaling. Those who have been ill for several days see improvements, lighter cases recover quickly. For a dry mouth and throat, use tea to wash it down.

Moreover, it is sung: "For years of coughing, hard to treat, avoid foolish doctors, don’t waste your money; finely crush winter flowers into powder, burn the smoke, and inhale it down your throat."

San Qi San treats all types of cough, regardless of duration, for those who wheeze without pause, day and night without respite.

  • Winter flowers: 200 wen
  • Buddha's ear grass: 50 wen
  • Rehmannia root: 2 taels

Dry roast the above, grind it into powder. Use 2 large coins, place a strong fire in a censer to burn it, make a paper tube, one end large and one end small, shaped like a zongzi, and rest it on the censer. Inhale the smoke until it is exhausted, then wash it down with clear tea, producing saliva.

In "Experiential Formulas," Chen's family says: I have a servant who suffered from this ailment for a long time; medical treatments were as ineffective as water on stone. By chance, I acquired a maid from Yuan Prefecture at Qujiang, who newly prepared this medicine; after two doses, he was cured.

Xiao Qinglong Jia Shigao Decoction treats lung congestion, cough with shortness of breath, irritability, and wheezing, with a floating pulse and water in the heart area.

Ingredients:

  • 120 grams gypsum
  • Ma Huang (Ephedra) 90 grams
  • Shao Yao (Peony) 90 grams
  • Gui Zhi (Cinnamon twigs) 90 grams
  • Xi Xin (Asarum) 90 grams
  • Gan Cao (Licorice) 90 grams
  • Gan Jiang (Dried ginger) 90 grams
  • Wu Wei Zi (Schisandra) 60 ml
  • Ban Xia (Pinellia) 60 ml

Preparation:
Combine these nine ingredients with ten dongs of water. First, boil Ma Huang, skim off the foam, then add the other herbs and boil down to three liters. A strong person should take one liter, while a weak person should take less. Take three times a day. For children, take four doses.

Lou Qie Bai Bai Jiu Decoction treats chest obstruction, shortness of breath, coughing, and expectoration.

Ingredients:

  • One fruit of Lou (Aristolochia)
  • 250 grams of Qie Bai (Chinese chives)
  • 7 liters of white wine

Preparation:
Boil these three ingredients together to make two liters, divide, and take warm in divided doses.

Jiu Xian San treats cough with phlegm.

Ingredients:

  • 9 grams of Jiu Jian Bi Ma Zi leaves
  • 6 grams of white alum

Preparation:
Use 240 grams of pork, sliced thinly and cut in a checkerboard pattern, mix in the two herbs, wrap in lotus leaves, and steam with gentle heat until well done, chew finely, and wash down with light broth, followed by pressing down with solid food.

Zhi Sou San treats the previous conditions.

Ingredients:

  • 75 grams Ban Xia, rinsed seven times
  • 240 grams of dried white alum

Preparation:
Grind these two ingredients into a powder and mix with ginger to form dough-sized pills. Each dose is three to twenty pills, taken on an empty stomach with warm wine.

Qiongyu Paste (From "Medical Genuine Transmission")
For treating deficiency, fatigue, and dry cough:
Twelve ounces of ginseng, fifteen ounces of poria, five pounds of white honey (boil to remove foam), ten pounds of fresh Rehmannia, washed clean, crushed in a stone container to extract natural juice, avoiding iron utensils; five taels each of agarwood and amber.
Grind the ginseng, poria, agarwood, and amber into fine powder. First, mix the Rehmannia juice with white honey, strain it through fine silk to remove residues, then mix in the powdered medicine. Place in a suitable ceramic or silver bottle, cover with several layers of cotton paper, wrapped with reed leaves, seal the bottle mouth, and submerge in a sand pot or copper pot, using steady water to submerge the bottle neck, boil with soft fire for three days and nights. Remove, replace with wax paper several times, seal the bottle mouth, submerge in a well for half a day to remove fire poisons, then bring up, and again boil in the original pot for half a day to expel moisture, then store. Every morning and after noon, take one or two spoonfuls, adjusting with a cup of warm wine. For those who do not drink alcohol, clear broth is also acceptable.**[181p]

Breathalizing Pill: Treats persistent coughs with upper respiratory issues, foul odor in the throat, heart and eye pain due to agitation, noise in the ears, seasonal malicious toxins, inability to gain weight from food, chest congestion, excessive nausea with saliva, hard fullness beneath the heart, excessive drinking with little food, and painful nausea.

  • Sichuan pepper: 2 sheng
  • Apricot kernel: 1 sheng

  • Large Aconite: 5 pieces
  • Dried ginger: 4 qian
  • Ginseng: 4 qian
  • Cinnamon bark: 6 fen
  • Aconite: 7 fen
  • Asparagus: 1 qian

Combine these ten ingredients into a powder, treating the apricot kernels as fatty, gradually incorporating the herbal powder. Mix with syrup until fully blended. Take one pill daily, six to seven times during the day and three to four times at night, adjusting to warmth in the chest. If experiencing dreams of ghostly interactions or eating, use the whole centipede. If the food does not digest, add five he of apricot kernels. For urgent lower abdomen and back pain, add asparagus and eucommia. If there is wind, add three pieces of aconite and one piece of large aconite, not to be added after the beginning of summer. If there is lingering fluid retention, add three liang of lepidium.

Another prescription treats cough, fullness in the chest and sides, excessive salivation, and shortness of breath. To treat cough and shortness of breath, prepare a decoction of bulrush. Apricot Almond Decoction: Treats cough from cold and rising qi, alleviating nasal obstruction.

Apricot Kernel Decoction: For treating violent heat cough.

40 apricot kernels, 1 sheng of perilla seeds, 1 tael of orange peel, 4 taels of bupleurum. Boil these four ingredients in 1 sheng of water to obtain 3 shengs, divide into three doses, and consume regularly as a drink.

Yuanhua Decoction: For treating both new and chronic cough.

2 taels each of yuanhua and dried ginger, 2 sheng of white honey. Grind the two ingredients into powder, mix with the honey, and simmer on low heat until it becomes a paste. Take a piece the size of a jujube pit three times a day, adjusting the dosage as needed; those seeking relief can take more. It is commonly used to treat coughs caused by cold drinks. For chronic coughs persisting for thirty years, take 5 sheng of water, boil yuanhua to yield 3 shengs, strain, add ginger and honey, and simmer until it forms a paste for consumption.

Winter Decoction: For treating previous conditions.

Winter Flower: 3 taels each of powdered dried ginger and aster, 2 taels of schisandra, and 1 tael of yuanhua, cooked until red. First, boil these three ingredients in 10 sheng of water to yield 2.5 shengs, strain, then add yuanhua and powdered dried ginger, mix in 3 sheng of honey, blend it with the soup, and simmer in a copper pot until it becomes syrupy. Take about half a jujube each time, three times a day. This formula also treats coughs persisting for thirty years, whether associated with drinking or coughing, regardless of cold or different symptoms.[190p]

　　细辛　(艹款)冬花　防风　紫菀茸各三两　藜芦　蜀椒各二两　　右六味(口父)咀，取藜芦先着铜器中，次紫菀、次细辛、次(艹款)冬花、次椒，以大枣百枚，间着诸药，以水一斗二升，微火煮，令汁尽，出枣曝令燥，鸡鸣时服半枣，不知，明旦服一枚，以胸中温温为度。若强人欲嗽吐者，可小增，服之后吐脓囊裹结，吐后勿冷饮食，咳愈止药。药势静乃食，不尔令人吐不已。　　又方　治积年咳嗽，喉中呀声一发，不得坐卧。　　紫菀茸　贝母　半夏　桑根白皮　五味子　射干　百部各五分　(艹款)冬花　皂荚　干姜　陈皮去白　鬼督邮　细辛各四分　白石英　杏仁各八分　蜈蚣二枚　　右十六味为末，蜜和丸如梧子大。饮服十丸，日再，稍加至二十丸。崔氏无半夏、射干、干姜、陈皮、鬼督邮、细辛、白石英。用麻黄二两、芫根白皮一两半，以煮枣汤送下。[191p]

Xixin (Asarum) 3 taels, Donghua (Winter Flower) 3 taels, Fangfeng 3 taels, Zhiwan (Aster) 3 taels, Lilu (Rhizoma) 2 taels, and Shu Jiao (Sichuan Pepper) 2 taels.

Take half a jujube at crowing time; if that does not work, eat one in the morning, adjusting based on the warmth in the chest. If a robust person feels the urge to cough and spit, a slight increase in dosage may be necessary. After taking it, if there is purulent secretion or a lump comes out, do not consume cold food or drink. This remedy stops coughing, but one must eat only when the medicine’s effect is mild, or it may induce further vomiting.

Another formula treats upper respiratory cough, wheezing, sensations of obstruction in the throat, and spitting of blood.
Use two sheng each of ginger juice and apricot kernels, one sheng each of syrup and white honey, and two he of pig fat. First, cook the apricot kernels in pig fat until they turn yellow. Remove and dry with paper, then grind into a paste. Combine this with ginger juice and syrup, cook until suitable for making pills. Each dose is one apricot kernel size, taken six to seven times a day, gradually increasing.[194p]

　　锺乳七星散　一名吸散。治寒冷咳嗽，上气，胸满，唾脓血。　　锺乳粉　矾石　(艹款)冬花　桂心各等分　　右四味，治下筛，作如大豆七聚，七星形，以小筒吸取，酒送下，先食服，日三，不知加之，数试大验。又云：临卧并吸服之。　　又方　治前证。
　　锺乳粉　细辛　(艹款)冬花　天雄　紫菀茸　石膏各等分　　右六味，治下筛，取如大豆七聚，如前法吸之，日二，只得食粥，七日嗽愈乃止。若大豆聚不知，少益之，勿太多。
　　七星散　治三十年咳嗽。
　　(艹款)冬花　紫菀茸　桑根白皮　代赭石　细辛　伏龙肝各一两　　右六味，治下筛，作七星聚，聚如扁豆者，以竹筒口当药上，一一吸咽之，令药入腹中，先食，日三服；至四日复作七星聚，以一脔肉炙令熟，以展转药聚上，令药悉遍肉上，仰卧咀嚼之，细细咽汁，令药力尽，总咽却，取瘥止。未瘥复作如初。羊牛鹿肉皆可用，猪肉不可用。[195p]

Zhongru Qixing San, also known as Xisan, is used to treat cold cough, difficult breathing, chest fullness, and expectoration of pus and blood.

Ingredients: Zhongru powder, alum stone, winter flower (Chuan), and cassia heart, all equal parts.

For the preparation, mix the four ingredients to create clusters the size of large soybeans in a seven-star shape. Use a small tube to inhale the medicine and swallow it with wine, to be taken before meals three times a day. If one is unsure of the dosage, try it out repeatedly for effectiveness. It is also suggested to take it while lying down.

Another prescription for the same symptoms:

Ingredients: Zhongru powder, xixin (Asarum), winter flower, tianxiong (Aconitum), purple aster fluff, and gypsum, all equal parts.

Mix these six ingredients to create clusters the size of large soybeans, and use the same method of inhalation as before, but take it twice a day, consuming only porridge for seven days until the cough improves. If the soybean clusters are not familiar, gradually increase the amount, but do not overdo it.

Qixing San is also said to treat cough lasting thirty years.

Ingredients: Winter flower, purple aster fluff, white mulberry root bark, daizhe stone, xixin, and fulong liver, each one tael.

Mix the six ingredients to form seven-star clusters, similar to flat beans. Use a bamboo tube to inhale each cluster directly above the medicine, allowing it to enter the stomach. Take it three times a day before meals. After four days, reform the seven-star clusters using a piece of roasted meat to coat and fully absorb the medicine. Chew it thoroughly while lying on your back to ensure full absorption of the medicinal properties, swallowing the juice carefully. If healing has not occurred, repeat the procedure as initially done. Goat, beef, and deer meat can be used, but pork is not recommended.[195p]

　　团参饮子 【《济生方》，下同】 　治病因抑郁忧思，喜怒饥饱失宜，致脏气不平，咳嗽脓血，渐成肺痿，憎寒壮热，羸瘦困顿，将成劳瘵。　　人参　紫菀茸洗　阿胶蛤粉炒　百合蒸　细辛洗去叶土　(艹款)冬花　天门冬汤浸去心　杏仁去皮尖，炒　半夏汤泡七次　经霜桑叶　五味子各一两　甘草炙，五钱　　右(口父)咀，每服四钱，水一盏半，生盖五大片，煎至七分，去滓，食后温服。因气而咳者，宜加木香。咳而唾血有热者，加生地黄。咳而唾血有寒者，加锺乳粉。因疲极而咳嗽者，加黄芪。因损咳而唾血者，加没药、藕节。咳而呕逆，腹满不食，加白朮，仍倍加生姜。欬而小便多者，加益智仁。咳而大便溏者，去杏仁，加锺乳粉。咳而面浮气逆者，加沉香、柑皮煎。[196p]

The formula for treating diseases caused by depression and anxiety, improper regulation of emotions, hunger, and satiety, leads to an imbalance of internal qi, resulting in coughing with phlegm and blood, gradually developing into lung consumptive conditions, with aversion to cold and strong heat, emaciation, and fatigue, potentially leading to tuberculosis.

Ingredients:

  • Ginseng
  • Purple Aster mushroom, washed
  • Gelatin and clam powder, roasted
  • Lily, steamed
  • Asarum, washed to remove leaves and soil
  • (Herb "Kuan" winter flower)
  • Asparagus, soaked in decoction and heart removed
  • Apricot kernels, peeled and tips removed, roasted
  • Pinellia, soaked in decoction seven times
  • Frosted mulberry leaves
  • Schisandra, each one tael
  • Honey fried licorice, five qian

Preparation:
Chew the above ingredients; for each dose, take four qian, with one and a half cups of water, cover with five large slices, and boil down to seven parts. Strain and take warm after meals.

For cough related to qi, add wood fragrance. For coughing with blood and heat, add fresh Rehmannia. For coughing with blood and cold, add cow's milk powder. For coughing due to extreme fatigue, add astragalus. For cough leading to blood spitting, add myrrh and lotus root segments. For cough with nausea, bloating, and lack of appetite, add white atractylodes and double the amount of fresh ginger. For cough with frequent urination, add shorea turgida seeds. For cough with loose stools, omit the apricot kernels and add cow's milk powder. For cough with facial swelling and reverse qi, add sandalwood and dried tangerine peel in decoction.[196p]

　　半夏圆　治肺脏蕴热，痰嗽，胸膈塞满。　　(艹舌)蒌子去壳别研　半夏汤泡七次，焙末，各一两　　右件和匀，生姜自然汁打面糊为丸如梧桐子大。每服五十丸，食后，用姜汤送下。
　　诃子饮　治久嗽，语声不出。
　　诃子去核　杏子泡去皮尖，各一两　通草二钱半　　右(口父)咀，每服四钱，水一盏半，煨生姜切五片，煎至八分，去滓温服，食后。[197p]

Banxia Yuan treats lung heat accumulation, phlegm cough, and chest fullness. Remove the shell from the Luzi and grind it separately. Soak Banxia in water seven times, then dry it into a powder, each ingredient weighing one tael. Mix these thoroughly, then use natural ginger juice to make a dough for pills the size of a wutong seed. Take fifty pills after meals, using ginger soup to wash them down.

Hezi Yin treats chronic cough and loss of voice. Remove the pit from the Hezi and soak the apricots to remove the skin and tip, each weighing one tael. Use two and a half qian of Tongcao. Grind the ingredients, take four qian each time, add one and a half cups of water, simmer with five slices of fresh ginger, and boil to reduce to eight parts. Strain and take warm after meals.[197p]

　　百花膏　治喘嗽不已，或痰中有血。　　(艹款)冬花　百合蒸焙
　　右等分为细末，炼蜜为丸如龙眼大。每服一丸，食后临卧细嚼，姜汤咽下，噙化，尤佳。
　　椒红丸 【《中藏经》】 　治嗽不止，及补中益气进食。　　小蜀椒拣去目，净炒过出汗，二两　干山药　附子炮去皮脐，各一两　　右同为细末，以好酒煮淡木瓜和之，再入臼中，杵三五百下，丸如桐子大。每服十五丸，加至二十丸，空心食前盐汤温酒任下。泄泻，米饮下。如喉中痰涎如水鸡声，晓夕不止，一两服见效。
　　泽漆汤 【《金匮要略》】 　治肺咳上气脉沉者。　　泽漆三升，以东流水五斗，煮取一斗五升　紫参　白前　生姜各五分　半夏半升　甘草　黄芩　人参　桂心各三两　　右九味(口父)咀，内泽漆汁中煮取五升，温服五合，至夜尽。[198p]

Baihua Gao: Treats persistent cough, particularly when there is blood in the phlegm.

Ingredients: Winter flower, lily baked; equal parts ground finely, mixed with honey to form pills the size of longan. Take one pill after meals, chew well while lying down, and swallow with ginger decoction; this is especially beneficial.

Jiao Hong Wan (from Zhong Zang Jing): Treats unending cough and enhances energy for eating.

Ingredients: Small Sichuan pepper (two taels, picked and sweated from frying), dried mountain yam, processed aconite (each one tael). Grind all finely, cook with good wine and dilute papaya, then pound in a mortar for 300-500 times, forming pills the size of a tung seed. Take fifteen to twenty pills on an empty stomach with saline warm wine. For diarrhea, take with rice decoction. If there is phlegm in the throat resembling the sound of a water chicken, take one tael for effectiveness.

Ze Qi Tang (from Jin Kui Yao Lue): Treats lung cough with a sinking pulse.

Ingredients: Three sheng of ze qi, five dou of Dongli water, boil down to one dou and five sheng; five fen each of purple ginseng, white front, and fresh ginger; half sheng of pinellia; three taels each of licorice, huang qin, ginseng, and cinnamon. Grind these nine ingredients, boil with ze qi juice to yield five sheng, and take five parts warm until finished at night.[198p]

　　痰嗽方
　　白果二十一个，炒黄　麻黄去节，三钱　(艹款)冬花　苏子　制半夏　桑白皮蜜炙，各二钱　黄芩炒　杏仁去皮尖，各一钱半　甘草一钱　　右，水三锺，煎二锺，随时分作二服，不用姜。
　　团鱼丸 【《良方》】 　治骨蒸咳嗽潮热。　　团鱼一个　柴胡　前胡　贝母去心　知母　杏仁去皮尖，各五钱　　右共煮，待鱼熟，去骨甲裙，再煮，食肉饮汁，将药焙为末，仍以骨甲裙煮汁，和丸梧子大。每空心黄芪汤下三十丸，日二服，服尽，仍治参芪药调之。
　　橘皮半夏汤 【河间，下同】 　治痰壅涎嗽久不已者。常服，养液润燥，解肌热，止咳嗽。　　陈皮去白五钱　半夏汤洗七次，二钱半　　右为末，分作二服，每服水一锺半，生姜十片，同煎至七分，去滓稍热服。[199p]

Phlegm Cough Formula
Twenty-one roasted ginkgo nuts, three qian of mahuang without joints, two qian each of (herb) winter flower, perilla seeds, processed banxia, and mulberry bark with honey; one and a half qian each of roasted huangqin and peeled apricot kernels; one qian of licorice. Boil with three sheng of water until reduced to two sheng, divide into two doses as needed, without ginger.

Round Fish Pills [From "Good Formulas"]
For treating bone steaming with coughing and tidal heat. One round fish, five qian each of chaihu, qianhu, bulbus fritillaria without the heart, zhi mu, and peeled apricot kernels. Cook all together until the fish is done, remove bones and skin, then cook again, consuming the meat and drinking the broth. Grind the medicine into a powder, and use the bones and skin to cook the broth, forming pills about the size of a walnut. Take thirty pills with empty stomach using astragalus soup twice daily; after completing, continue with ginseng and astragalus to adjust.

Tangerine Peel and Banxia Decoction [Same as Hejian]
For treating phlegm blockage and prolonged cough. Regular use nourishes fluids, moistens dryness, alleviates muscle heat, and stops coughing. Five qian of old tangerine peel without the white part, and two and a half qian of banxia washed seven times; grind together into a powder, divide into two doses. Each dose is taken with one and a half sheng of water, ten slices of fresh ginger, and boil until reduced to seven parts, then strain and take warm.[199p]

　　防己丸　治肺不足，喘嗽久不已者，调顺气血，消化痰涎。　　防己　木香各二钱　杏仁三钱
　　右为末，炼蜜为丸如小豆大。每服二十丸，煎桑白皮汤下。如大便闭，加葶苈一两，食后服。
　　宁神散　治一切痰嗽不已，世传极验。　　御米囊一斤酢炒　乌梅四两
　　右为末，每服二三钱，沸汤点，常服，食后，日三服。
　　仙人肢丸　治远年劳嗽，不问寒热，痰涎喘满，先服松花膏，下过多，服此药无不效。　　蛤蚧一对，头尾全用，河水净洗，文武火酥炙黄色　人参　沙参　元参　紫团参　丹参　白朮　牡蛎　知母　甘草各二两　　右为末，用麻黄十五斤去根、枸杞子三斤，熬成膏，丸如弹子大，磁盒子盛，临卧煎生姜自然汁化下一丸。小儿量岁数加减。[200p]

Fangji Pill: It treats lung insufficiency, lasting cough and wheezing. It regulates Qi and blood, and dissolves phlegm. Ingredients: Fangji and Mu Xiang, each 6 grams; Xingren, 9 grams.

Grind these into powder and refine with honey to form pills about the size of small beans. Take 20 pills each time, and wash down with a decoction of mulberry root. If there is constipation, add one ounce of Tingli to be taken after meals.

Ningshen Powder: It treats all persistent phlegm and cough, known for its effectiveness. Ingredients: Yi Mi Nang, 500 grams, stir-fried in vinegar; Wumei, 200 grams.

Grind into powder, taking 6-9 grams each time, infused in boiling water. It should be taken regularly after meals, three times a day.

Xianren Zhi Pill: It treats long-term labor coughs, regardless of cold or heat, with phlegm and wheezing fullness. Taking Songhua Gao beforehand will enhance the effect of this medicine. Ingredients: A pair of Gejia, cleaned thoroughly, roasted until yellow; and each of the following: Ginseng, Shashen, Yuanshen, Zituan Shen, Danshen, Baizhu, Muli, Zhimu, and Licorice, each 60 grams.

Grind into powder, then take 7.5 kg of Ma Huang, remove the roots, and 1.5 kg of Goji berries, boil into a paste, forming pills the size of a ball. Store in a ceramic box. Before bedtime, brew a fresh ginger decoction to dissolve one pill. Adjust the amount for children according to their age.[200p]

　　石膏散　治热嗽喘甚者。
　　石膏一两　甘草炙，半两
　　右为末，每服三钱，新汲水下，或生姜汁蜜调下。
　　大百劳散　治一切劳嗽肌劣，喘息不卧，痰涎不食。　　蛤蚧一对，蜜炙　鳖甲一个，去裙酢炙　甘草炙　人参　柴胡　干姜　白茯苓　白朮　茴香　青皮　杏仁去皮尖　知母　贝母　陈皮去白　官桂　附子　半夏姜制　苍朮汤浸，各一两　苏木　龙胆草各五钱　　右为末，每服二钱，水一盏，用生姜三片，枣二枚，乌梅二枚，同煎，空心稍热服。有汗加小麦二十粒，不用铁器。
　　小百劳散　治劳喘嗽不已，自汗者。　　御米壳不拘多少炒
　　右为末，每服二钱，入乌梅同煎，水一盏，温服，食后。有汗加小麦三十粒，同煎温服。
　　芦筒散　治男子妇人一切咳嗽喘急。　　(艹款)冬花　井泉石　鹅管石　锺乳石　官桂　甘草　白矾　佛耳草各等分　　右为末，每服一钱，竹筒子吸吃，日三服，立效。[201p]

Gypsum Powder: For treating severe coughing and asthma due to heat.

  • One liang of gypsum, half a liang of honey-fried licorice.
    Grind these into a powder. Take three qian each time with fresh spring water, or mix with ginger juice and honey.

Great Baillou Powder: For all kinds of cough due to labor, muscle weakness, difficulty breathing at rest, and inability to eat phlegm.

  • A pair of gecko, honey-fried; one turtle shell, skins removed and honey-fried; honey-fried licorice; ginseng; bupleurum; dried ginger; white poria; white atractylodes; fennel; green tangerine peel; blanched almonds; anemarrhena; fritillaria; dried orange peel; cinnamon; aconite; fresh pinellia; soaked in caustic poria, each one liang; five qian each of sonneratia and gentian.
    Grind these into a powder. Take two qian each time with a cup of water, using three slices of fresh ginger, two dates, and two black plums, boiled together and taken warm on an empty stomach. If sweating occurs, add twenty grains of wheat, avoiding iron utensils.

Minor Baillou Powder: For continuous labor-induced cough and spontaneous sweating.

  • The hulls of imperial rice, roasted without restriction of quantity.
    Grind into a powder. Take two qian with black plum boiled in a cup of water and drink warm after meals. If sweating occurs, add thirty grains of wheat, boiled together and taken warm.

Reed Tube Powder: For all men and women with coughing and rapid breathing.

  • Equal parts of winter flower, spring water stone, goose pipe stone, stalactite stone, cinnamon, licorice, white alum, and Buddha ear herb.
    Grind these into a powder. Take one qian each time, sucking through a bamboo tube, three times a day for immediate effect.[201p]

　　罂粟神圣散　治男子妇人久新日夜咳嗽不止者。　　御米壳一两，蜜炒　乌梅肉　人参　诃子肉　葶苈　桑白皮各五钱　　右为细末，每股二三钱，百沸汤临卧调下。

Sacred Poppy Powder: Treats men and women with persistent cough that does not stop day or night. Ingredients: One tael of rice husks, honey-fried black plum flesh, ginseng, myrobalan fruit, radish seeds, each five qian; mulberry white bark. Grind these into a fine powder. Take two to three qian for each dose, and mix with boiling soup before bed.

Water-Boiled Golden Pill: Treats cough with wind, phlegm, and heat. Symptoms include a wiry pulse, a pale face, fullness and heaviness in the limbs, urinary issues, and irritability. Ingredients: One tael each of South Star, fresh pinellia tuber; calcined cold water stone; half a tael of Tianma; two qian of realgar; three taels of white flour. Grind into a fine powder, mix with water to form pills. Take fifty to seventy pills, up to a hundred. Boil the medicinal formula in water until it floats, strain, soak in light broth, and take with fresh ginger soup. Alternatively, combine with Banxia and use the prescriptions for Chuanxiong Wan or Fangfeng Wan as needed.

Small Yellow Pill: Treats cough with hot phlegm. Symptoms include a rapid pulse, red face, irritability, heart pain, dry lips and mouth, and excessive laughter. Ingredients: One tael each of South Star and fresh pinellia tuber, and one and a half taels of Scutellaria. Grind into a fine powder, soak in ginger juice, steam into pills about the size of a tung seed. Take fifty to seventy pills after meals, with ginger soup. It is also acceptable to add to Xiaochaihu Decoction with Banxia.[202p]

　　白朮丸　治痰湿咳嗽，脉缓面黄，肢体沉重，嗜卧，津液不收，腹胀而食不消化，宜之。　　南星　半夏俱汤洗，各一两　白朮一两半　　右为细末，糊为丸桐子大。每服五七十丸，生姜汤下。及《局方》中防己丸亦可。
　　玉粉丸　治气痰咳嗽，脉濇面白，上喘气促，洒淅恶寒，忧愁不乐，宜服之。　　南星　陈橘皮　半夏俱洗，各一两
　　右为细末，薄糊为丸如桐子大。每服五七十丸，生姜汤下，食后。及《局方》中防己丸亦可。玉粉丸加减在后：心下痞，加枳实五钱。身热甚，加黄连五钱。体重，加茯苓一两。气上逆，加苦葶苈五钱。气促，加人参、桔梗各五钱。浮肿，加(木郁)李仁杏仁各五钱。大便秘，加大黄五钱。寒痰，去橘皮，加官桂。[203p]

Bai Zhu Pills treat phlegm and damp coughs, with a slow pulse, yellowish face, heavy limbs, a tendency to sleep, lack of fluid retention, abdominal distension, and indigestion; they are suitable for these symptoms. Ingredients: Nan Xing and Ban Xia, each one liang; Bai Zhu, one and a half liang. Grind to a fine powder, mix into a paste to form pills the size of tung seeds. Take 50 to 70 pills with ginger soup. The Fangji Pills in "Jumai Prescription" can also be used.

Yu Fen Pills treat qi phlegm coughs, with a thin pulse, pale face, shortness of breath, chills, unhappiness, and are suitable for these conditions. Ingredients: Nan Xing, Chen Ju Pi, and Ban Xia, each one liang. Grind to a fine powder, mix into a thin paste to form pills the size of tung seeds. Take 50 to 70 pills with ginger soup after meals. The Fangji Pills in "Jumai Prescription" can also be used. Adjustments for Yu Fen Pills: if there is a feeling of fullness below the heart, add five qian of Zhi Shi; if there is significant body heat, add five qian of Huang Lian; if the body feels heavy, add one liang of Fu Ling; if qi rises abnormally, add five qian of Ku Tsing Li; if shortness of breath occurs, add five qian each of Ren Shen and Jie Geng; for edema, add five qian each of Li Ren and Xing Ren; for constipation, add five qian of Da Huang; for cold phlegm, remove the tangerine peel and add Guo Gui.[203p]

　　防风丸　治痰嗽胸中气不清者。枳朮丸亦妙。　　防风　枳壳去瓤麸炒，各五钱　白朮一两　　右为细末，蒸饼为丸，每服五七十丸，生姜汤下。
　　五味黄芪散 【《拔萃方》】 　治咳嗽，咯血成劳，眼睛疼痛，四肢困倦，脚膝无力。　　麦门冬　熟地黄各一钱　桔梗　黄芪各钱半　五味子　人参　芍药　甘草各五分　　右作一服，水二盏，煎八分，食后温服。
　　三圣丹 【《正传》】 　治久嗽极效。　　天南星煨裂，一两　大半夏汤泡七次，二两　甘草生五钱　　先以星夏二味，研为细末，用生姜自然汁拌匀，盦作曲，春秋七日、冬十日、夏五日取出，再同甘草共研为细末，别取淡竹沥一碗，将前药末用竹沥拌捏，作饼子焙干，又将竹沥沃湿，又焙干。如此沃焙十数次，待竹沥尽为度，研为细末，用白沙蜜，每临卧抄一匙于口内，噙化下，再用竹沥漱口咽之。[204p]

Fangfeng Pill: This treats phlegm cough and unclear Qi in the chest. The Zhizhu Pill is also effective. Ingredients: Fangfeng and Zhike, each with the core removed, stir-fried, both five qian; Baizhu, one liang. Grind these into a fine powder, make into pills with steamed dough, and take 50 to 70 pills each time, washed down with ginger soup.

Wuwu Huangqi Powder (from "Bacui Fang"): This treats cough, excessive phlegm with blood, eye pain, limb fatigue, and weakness in the knees and feet. Ingredients: Maidong and Shudi, each one qian; Zhiqiao and Huangqi, each half qian; Wuweizi, Renshen, Shaoyao, and Gancao, each five fen. Prepare as a single dose, boil with two bowls of water until reduced to one bowl, and take warm after meals.

San Sheng Dan (from "Zheng Chuan"): This is extremely effective for chronic cough. Ingredients: Tian Nansheng, baked and cracked, one liang; Dabanxia, soaked in decoction seven times, two liang; Gancao, five qian. First, grind Tian Nansheng and Dabanxia into a fine powder, mix with the natural juice of fresh ginger, shape into pieces and leave for seven days in spring and autumn, ten days in winter, and five days in summer. Then grind again with Gancao into a fine powder. Take one bowl of thin bamboo juice, mix the earlier powder with bamboo juice, shape into cakes, and dry them. Additionally, wet with bamboo juice and dry again. Repeat this wetting and drying process ten times until no bamboo juice remains, then grind into fine powder. Use white sand honey, taking one spoonful before bed, letting it dissolve in the mouth, and rinse with bamboo juice before swallowing.[204p]

Treats heat obstruction in the upper jiao, with blood-tinged phlegm, persistent cough, and difficulty in breathing.

Feng Sui Decoction: Treats cough, greatly capable of moistening the lungs.
Ingredients: 1 pound of beef marrow, taken from the bones; peeled and pointed apricot kernels, ground into a paste; roasted yam; peeled walnut kernels, ground separately, each 4 ounces; 0.5 pounds of white honey.

Pour into a ceramic bottle, add the apricot kernels and other three ingredients into the bottle, seal the mouth with paper, and simmer in water day and night. Xingren Decoction
Treats all coughs.
Half a pound of apricot kernels, remove the skin and tip. Soak in the right child's urine, changing it once a day; in summer, change it three times a day. Soak for half a month, rinse, dry, and grind into a very fine powder. Take a dose the size of a jujube, mix with mint tea sweetened with honey, take after meals; several doses will cure completely.

Baidu Powder (from "Ju Fang")
Treats phlegm cough with body heat and nasal congestion.
Eight parts of Chai Hu, Qian Hu, Qiang Huo, Du Huo, Ren Shen, Fu Ling, Zhi Ke, Chuan Xiong, and Jie Geng; four parts of Gan Cao. Boil with two cups of water, one green onion, and one jujube; simmer until reduced to two-thirds. Take at any time.

Sang Pi Powder (from "Yi Lin")
Treats heat accumulation in the upper jiao, coughing with bloody phlegm, causing difficulty in breathing.
Fried mulberry bark, Qian Hu, Chai Hu, Zi Su, mint, Zhi Ke, Jie Geng, red Fu Ling, Huang Qin, and honey-fried Gan Cao, equal parts. Grind, take seven qian (weights), boil with two cups of water, reduce to seven-tenths, take warm after meals.

Xie Bai Powder (from "Ji Sheng Fang")
Treats lung congestion with vexation and cough, and constipation.
Equal parts of Jie Geng, Gan Cao, mulberry white bark, Chen Pi, Ban Xia, apricot kernels, (cāo shé) Lou Zi (a type of plant), and Di Gu Pi. Grind, take eight qian, boil with two cups of water, add five slices of ginger, simmer until reduced to two-thirds, take after meals.

Shuang Yu Powder (from "Yi Lao")
Treats phlegm-heat with cough, wheezing, and phlegm.
Equal parts of Han Shui Shi and Shi Gao.[212p]

　　右为细末，每服三钱，人参煎汤调下，食后临卧服。
　　大补元煎 【《景岳全书》，下同】 　治男妇血气大坏，精神失守，咳嗽危剧等证。　　人参少则二三钱，多则一二两　枸杞二三钱　熟地少则二三钱，多则二三两　炙甘草一二钱　当归二三钱，泄泻勿用　山茱萸一钱，畏酸吞酸勿用　杜仲　山药炒，各二钱　　水二锺，煎七分，温服。

The above is a fine powder; take three qian each time, decoct with ginseng and drink it after meals when going to bed.

Great Restoration Decoction: This treats serious conditions in men and women due to severe blood and qi deficiency, loss of spirit, dangerous coughing, etc.
Ginseng, a little as two or three qian, or more as one or two liang.
Goji berries, two or three qian.
Cooked rehmannia, a little as two or three qian, or more as two or three liang.
Honey-fried licorice, one or two qian.
Angelica, two or three qian (do not use in cases of diarrhea).
Cornelian cherry, one qian (avoid if sensitive to acidity).
Eucommia and processed Chinese yam, each two qian.
Add two sheng of water, decoct to seven parts, and take warm after meals.

Left Return Decoction: This is a tonic for water. For those with weakened Yin of the Mingmen and excess Yang who cough, this formula with adjustments is suitable.
Cooked rehmannia, two or three qian, or increased to one or two liang.
Honey-fried licorice, one qian.
Cornelian cherry, one or two qian (reduce if sensitive to acidity).
Poria, one and a half qian.
Chinese yam and goji berries, each two qian.
Add two sheng of water, decoct to seven parts, and take warm away from meals.

Right Return Decoction: This is a tonic for fire. For those with weakened Yang of the Mingmen and excess Yin who cough, this formula with adjustments is suitable.
Cooked rehmannia as before, with processed Chinese yam, eucommia prepared with ginger, and goji berries, each two qian.
Cornelian cherry flesh, one qian.
Honey-fried licorice and cinnamon, each one or two qian.
Processed Aconite, one to three qian.
Add two sheng of water, decoct to seven parts, and take warm away from meals.[213p]

　　左归丸　治真阴肾水不足，不能滋养荣卫，渐至衰弱咳嗽，宜壮水之主，以培左肾之元阴，而精血自充矣。宜此方主之。　　熟地八两　山药炒　枸杞　山萸　菟丝子制　鹿胶炒珠，各四两　牛膝好酒洗蒸，三两，精滑者勿用　龟板胶切碎炒珠，四两，无火者不用　　右将熟地蒸烂杵膏，加炼蜜丸桐子大，每食前用滚汤或淡盐汤下百余丸。如火铄肺，加百合三两。
　　右归丸　治元气不足，或先天禀衰，或劳伤过度，以致命门火衰，不能生土，而为脾胃虚寒，神疲气怯，或心跳不宁，或四肢不收，或眼见邪祟，或阳衰无子，咳嗽等证，俱速宜益火之原，以培右肾之元阳，而神气自强矣。此方主之。　　熟地八两　制附子二两，渐加至五六两　肉桂二两，渐加至四两　当归便溏勿用　山萸肉炒，各三两　山药炒　枸杞微炒　菟丝子制　鹿角胶炒珠　杜仲姜汁炒，各四两　　右，丸法如前，或丸如弹子大。每嚼服二三丸，以滚白汤送下，其效尤速。[214p]

Zuǒ Guī Wán treats insufficiency of true yin and kidney water, which cannot nourish the defensive and nutrient aspects, gradually leading to weakness and coughing. It is advisable to strengthen the governing water to nurture the primordial yin of the left kidney, thereby replenishing essence and blood. This formula is appropriate for that purpose.

Ingredients:

  • 8 taels of cooked rehmannia
  • 4 taels each of stir-fried yam, goji berries, mountain blackthorn fruit, processed dodder seed, and fried deer horn gelatin pearls
  • 3 taels of good-quality ox knee, washed and steamed with liquor, avoiding excessive fine texture
  • 4 taels of turtle shell gelatin, cut into small pieces and fried into pearls, avoiding those without fire.

Method: Steam the cooked rehmannia until softened and pound it into a paste. Mix and form into pills the size of a tung seed with refined honey, taking 100 pills before meals with boiling soup or light salt soup. If there is heat affecting the lungs, add 3 taels of lily.

Yòu Guī Wán treats insufficient primal qi, whether due to congenital weakness or excessive labor injury, leading to a decline of the fire at the life gate, which cannot generate earth, resulting in spleen and stomach deficiency with coldness, fatigue, anxiety, or symptoms such as palpitations, unretracted limbs, seeing evil spirits, declining vitality with infertility, coughing, etc. It is essential to quickly enhance the source of fire to nourish the primordial yang of the right kidney, thus strengthening the vitality and spirit. This formula is suitable for such conditions.

Ingredients:

  • 8 taels of cooked rehmannia
  • 2 taels of processed aconite, gradually increasing to 5-6 taels
  • 2 taels of cinnamon, gradually increasing to 4 taels
  • Do not use processed angelica in excess
  • 3 taels each of stir-fried mountain blackthorn fruit, stir-fried yam, lightly stir-fried goji berries, processed dodder seed, fried deer antler gelatin pearls, and stir-fried eucommia with ginger juice.

Method: The method for preparing pills is as before, or form into size of small pellets. Chew and take 2-3 pills with boiling white soup for quicker effect.[214p]

　　五福饮　凡五脏气虚，亏损咳嗽者，此皆能治之。　　人参　熟地各随宜　当归三钱　炙甘草一钱　白朮炒，一钱半　　水二锺，煎七分，食远温服。或加生姜三五片。
　　一阴煎　此治水亏火胜之剂，故曰一阴。凡肾水真阴虚损，而脉证多阳，虚火发热，及阴虚火痰咳嗽等证，皆宜用此加减主之。　　生地　芍药　麦冬　丹参各二钱　甘草一钱　熟地三五钱　牛膝一钱半　　水二锺，煎七分，食远温服。[215p]

Wufu Decoction
For those with deficiency of the five organs, who suffer from cough due to loss, this can treat them.

  • Ginseng and cooked Rehmannia as needed
  • Three qian of Angelica
  • One qian of roasted Licorice
  • One and a half qian of fried Atractylodes
  • Two sheng of water, decoct for seven parts, take warm after meals. Optionally add three to five slices of fresh ginger.

Yin Decoction
This treats water deficiency and excessive fire, hence the name "One Yin." For cases where the kidney's true Yin is deficient, leading to abundant Yang signs, heat from empty fire, and symptoms like cough with phlegm due to Yin deficiency, this should be used with appropriate adjustments.

  • Two qian each of raw Rehmannia, Peony, Ophiopogon, and Salvia
  • One qian of Licorice
  • Three to five qian of cooked Rehmannia
  • One and a half qian of Achyranthes
  • Two sheng of water, decoct for seven parts, take warm after meals.[215p]

　　加减一阴煎　治证如前，而火之甚者，宜用此方。　　生地　芍药　麦冬各二钱　熟地三五钱　炙甘草五七分　知母　地骨皮各一钱　　水二锺，煎服。

　　四阴煎　此保肺清金之剂，故曰四阴。治阴虚劳损，相火炽盛，津液枯竭，咳嗽吐衄多热等证。　　生地二三钱　生甘草一钱　茯苓一钱半　麦冬　白芍药　百合　沙参各二钱　　水二锺，煎七分，食远服，金水不能相滋而干燥喘嗽者，加熟地三五钱。
　　金水六君煎　治肺肾虚寒，水泛为痰，或年迈阴虚，血气不足，外受风寒，咳嗽呕恶，多痰喘急等证，神效。　　当归　半夏　茯苓各二钱　熟地三五钱　陈皮一钱半　炙甘草一钱　　水二锺，生姜三五七片，煎七八分，食远温服。[216p]

Jia Jian Yi Yin Decoction: This is used for conditions as previously described, especially when the heat is intense. Ingredients: raw Rehmannia, Peony root, and Ophiopogon, each 2 qian; cooked Rehmannia, 3 to 5 qian; honey-fried Licorice, 5 to 7 fen; Anemarrhena and Lygodium, each 1 qian. Boil with 2 zhongs of water and take.

Si Yin Decoction: This is a remedy to preserve the lungs and clear the metal, hence it is called Si Yin. It treats symptoms of Yin deficiency causing weariness, excessive rising fire, depletion of fluids, heat-related cough, and hemoptysis. Ingredients: raw Rehmannia, 2 to 3 qian; raw Licorice, 1 qian; Poria, 1.5 qian; Ophiopogon, white Peony root, Lily, and Glehnia root, each 2 qian. Boil with 2 zhongs of water until reduced to 7 parts, take after meals. For those who cannot nourish with metal and water resulting in dryness and wheezing, add 3 to 5 qian of cooked Rehmannia.

Jin Shui Liu Jun Decoction: This treats lung and kidney deficiency cold, with water accumulating as phlegm, or elderly patients with Yin deficiency and insufficient blood and qi, externally attacked by wind-cold, presenting symptoms of cough, nausea, excessive phlegm, and acute wheezing. It is highly effective. Ingredients: Angelica, Pinellia, and Poria, each 2 qian; cooked Rehmannia, 3 to 5 qian; dried Tangerine peel, 1.5 qian; honey-fried Licorice, 1 qian. Boil with 2 zhongs of water, adding 3, 5, or 7 slices of fresh ginger, boil until reduced by 7 to 8 parts, take warm away from meals.[216p]

　　六安煎　治风寒咳嗽，及非风初感，痰滞气逆等证。　　陈皮钱半　半夏二三钱　杏仁　甘草各一钱　白芥子五七分，老弱不用　茯苓二钱　　水一锺半，加生姜三五七片，煎七分，食远服。凡外感风邪咳嗽，而寒气盛者，多不易散，宜加北细辛七八分或一钱。若风邪咳嗽不止而兼肺胃之火者，加黄芩一二钱。甚者再加知母石膏，所用生姜，止用一片。凡寒邪咳嗽痰不利者，加当归二三钱。老年者尤宜。若气血不足者，当以金水六君煎，与此参用。
　　贝母丸　消痰清热，润肺止咳。
　　贝母一两
　　右为末，用沙糖或蜜和丸龙眼大，或噙化，或嚼服之。若欲劫止久嗽，每贝母一两，宜加百药煎、蓬砂、天竺黄各一钱佐之，尤妙。如无百药煎，即酢炒文蛤一钱亦可，或粟壳亦可酌用。[217p]

Liu'an Pills treat coughs caused by wind-cold, as well as initial symptoms of wind invasion, phlegm stagnation, and reversed qi.

Ingredients:

  • Half a qian of dried citrus peel
  • Two to three qian of pinellia
  • One qian of apricot kernels
  • One qian of licorice
  • Five to seven fen of white mustard seed (not to be used by the old and weak)
  • Two qian of poria
  • One and a half zhōng of water, adding three to five or seven slices of fresh ginger, and decocting for seven parts. Take on an empty stomach.

For coughs caused by external wind with significant cold, it is often difficult to disperse; add seven to eight fen or one qian of northern xixin. If the cough persists due to wind and is accompanied by lung and stomach fire, add one to two qian of scutellaria. In severe cases, add Zhimu and gypsum, using only one slice of fresh ginger. For coughs with cold evil and ineffective phlegm, add two to three qian of angelica, especially suitable for the elderly. If there is a deficiency of qi and blood, it is advisable to use Jinsuijun decoction alongside this.

Baimu Pills clear phlegm, alleviate heat, moisten the lungs, and stop coughing.

Ingredients:

  • One liang of fritillaria

Grind the above into powder, mix with sand sugar or honey, and form pills the size of longan, which may be dissolved in the mouth or chewed. If one wishes to stop a lingering cough, for every liang of fritillaria, it is advisable to add one qian each of Baoyaosuan, selaginella, and turmeric, which is particularly effective. If Baoyaosuan is unavailable, one qian of vinegar-fried clams can also be used, or corn husks may be used as needed.[217p]

　　柴陈煎　治伤风兼寒，咳嗽发热，痞满多痰等证。　　柴胡二三钱　陈皮一钱半　甘草一钱　半夏　茯苓各二钱　生姜三五七片　　水一锺半，煎七分，食远温服。气逆多嗽者，加杏仁一钱。
　　六味回阳饮六味回阳饮　据《景岳全书》，此方当有制附子。治阴阳将脱咳喘等证。　　人参一二两或数钱　熟地黄五钱或一两　炮干姜各二三钱　当归身三钱，泄泻或动血者，以冬朮代之　炙甘草一钱　　水二锺，武火煎七分，温服。

咳嗽门

　　　　单方

　　卒暴欬嗽：用白墡土粉白矾一两为末，姜汁糊丸梧子大，临卧姜汤服二十丸。 【《普济方》】
　　老嗽不止：故茅屋上尘，年久着烟火者，和石黄、(艹款)冬花、妇人月经衣带为末，水和涂茅上，待干，入竹筒中烧烟吸咽，无不瘥也。 【《藏器》】[218p]

Chai Chen Jian: Treats symptoms of wind-cold, cough with fever, feelings of fullness with phlegm, etc.

Ingredients:

  • Chai Hu (Bupleurum) 2-3 qian
  • Chen Pi (Dried Tangerine Peel) 1.5 qian
  • Gan Cao (Licorice) 1 qian
  • Ban Xia (Pinellia) 2 qian
  • Fu Ling (Poria) 2 qian
  • Sheng Jiang (Fresh Ginger) 3-5-7 slices

Prepare with 1.5 sheng of water, decoct to 7 portions, and take warm on an empty stomach. For those with much coughing due to rebellious qi, add 1 qian of Xing Ren (Apricot Kernel).

Liu Wei Hui Yang Yin: According to the "Complete Book of Jingyue," this formula should contain processed Fu Zi. It treats symptoms of impending collapse of yin and yang, cough, and wheezing.

Ingredients:

  • Ren Shen (Ginseng) 1-2 liang or several qian
  • Shu Di Huang (Cooked Rehmannia) 5 qian or 1 liang
  • Pao Gan Jiang (Processed Dried Ginger) 2-3 qian
  • Dang Gui Shen (Angelica Root) 3 qian, for diarrhea or blood motion, substitute with Dong Zhong (Winter Worm)
  • Zhi Gan Cao (Prepared Licorice) 1 qian

Prepare with 2 sheng of water, and boil over medium heat to reduce to 7 portions; take warm.

Cough Section

Single Prescription

For sudden violent cough: Use 1 liang of white clay powder and alum, grind to powder, mix with ginger juice to form pills the size of a tree nut, and take twenty pills with ginger soup before bed.

For chronic cough: For those with dust from old thatched roofs and smoke exposure, mix Shi Huang (Yellow Ochre), Dong Hua (Winter Flower), and women's menstrual sashes to a powder, water them to apply to the thatched roof, let dry, then burn in a bamboo tube and inhale the smoke—there will be no illness that cannot be cured.[218p]

　　卒然欬嗽：炉中铅屑、桂心、皂荚等分为末，蜜丸如梧子大。每米饮下十五丸。忌葱。【《备急方》】
　　三十年呷嗽：熏黄、木香、莨菪子等分为末，羊脂涂青纸上，以末铺之，作筒烧烟吸也。【《崔氏方》】
　　欬嗽熏法：熏黄一两，以蜡纸调卷作筒十枚，烧烟吸咽取吐，止一日一熏。惟食白粥，七日后，以羊肉羹补之。【《千金方》】
　　水肿上气，咳嗽腹胀：熏黄一两，(艹款)冬花二分，熟艾一分，以蜡纸铺艾，酒二末于上，荻管卷成筒，烧煨吸咽，三十日则瘥。三日尽一剂，百日断盐酢。【《外台》】
　　肺劳咳嗽：雌黄一两，入瓦盒内，不固济，坐地上，以火焙之，厚二寸，以炭一斤，簇定顶火煅三分去一，退火出毒为末，糖酥和丸粟米大，每日空心杏仁汤下三丸。【《斗门方》】
　　咳嗽涎喘，不问年深日久：用经霜枇杷叶、经霜桑叶、御米壳蜜炒，各一两为末，蜜丸弹子大。每服一丸，白汤化下，日一服，名无忧丸[219p]

Sudden cough: Grind lead filings, cassia heart, and soap pods into a fine powder, mix with honey to form balls the size of a phoenix nut. Take fifteen balls with each meter of drink. Avoid green onions.

For cough lasting thirty years: Grind yellow incense, wood fragrance, and datura seeds into a fine powder, apply sheep fat onto blue paper, spread the powder on it, and roll it into a cylinder to inhale the smoke.

Cough treatment method: One ounce of yellow incense, rolled into ten tubes with wax paper to burn and inhale the smoke, take once a day. Only eat plain porridge, and after seven days, supplement with sheep meat soup.

For water retention and cough with abdominal swelling: One ounce of yellow incense, two parts winter flower, one part moxa, spread moxa with wax paper, place two powders of wine on top, roll it into a tube of reed, burn and inhale the smoke for thirty days to recover. Use one dose within three days, and abstain from salt and vinegar for a hundred days.

For lung disease cough: One ounce of yellow oxide, placed in a clay box, not sealed, sit on the ground and bake it with fire, two inches thick, with one pound of charcoal, keep the fire steady and calcine for three minutes, remove fire to eliminate toxins, grind into powder, mix with sugar to form pills the size of millet, take three pills daily on an empty stomach with apricot soup.

For cough with phlegm and wheezing, regardless of duration: Use frostbitten loquat leaves, frostbitten mulberry leaves, fried honey with rice husks, one ounce each to grind into a powder, mix with honey to form balls the size of marbles. Take one ball and dissolve it in warm water once a day, known as "Carefree Pills."[219p]

　　风痰咳嗽：大天南星一枚，炮裂研末。每服一钱，水一盏，姜三片，煎五分，温服。每早午晚各一服。【《博济方》】
　　肺热痰嗽：制半夏、(艹舌)蒌仁各一两为末，姜汁打糊丸梧子大。每服二三十丸，白汤下；或以(艹舌)蒌瓤煮熟丸。【《济生方》】
　　老小暴嗽：石灰一两，蛤粉四钱为末，蒸饼丸豌豆大，焙干，每服三十丸，温虀汁下。【《普济方》】
　　欬嗽不止：浮石末汤服，或蜜丸服。 【《肘后方》】
　　化痰治嗽：明矾二两，生参末一两，苦酒二升，熬为膏子，以油纸包收，旋丸豌豆大。每用一丸放舌下，其嗽立止，痰即消。　　又方：明矾末酒糊丸梧子大，每睡时茶下二三十丸。　　又方：用明矾半生半烧，山栀子炒黑，等分为末，姜汁糊为丸，如上服。　　又方：用白明矾建茶等分为末，糊服。[220p]

Cough with Phlegm: One piece of large Chinese yam, pulverized after being roasted. Take one qian with a cup of water, three slices of ginger, decoct for five minutes, and take it warm. One dose each morning, noon, and evening.

Cough due to Lung Heat: Take one liang each of prepared Pinellia and Trichosanthes seeds, grind to powder, mix with ginger juice to form pills the size of walnuts. Take twenty to thirty pills with warm water; alternatively, boil the pulp of Trichosanthes and form pills.

Cough in the Elderly and Children: One liang of lime, four qian of clam powder, ground to a powder. Steam into pills the size of peas and bake dry. Take thirty pills with warm ginger juice.

Persistent Cough: Take powdered floating stone with warm water, or take honey pills.

Transforming Phlegm and Treating Cough: Two liang of alum, one liang of raw ginseng powder, two sheng of bitter wine, reduce to a paste, wrap in oil paper, and form pills the size of peas. Place one under the tongue; the cough will stop and the phlegm will dissolve.

Additional Recipe: Alum powder mixed with wine to form pills the size of walnuts, taken with tea before sleep.

Another Recipe: Use half raw and half roasted alum, blackened gardenia, ground equally to powder, and form pills with ginger juice, and take as noted above.

Yet Another Recipe: Use white alum, ground with tea equally to powder, and consume as a paste.[220p]

　　肺虚久嗽：人参末二两，鹿角胶炙研一两，每服三钱，用薄荷豉汤一盏，葱少许，入铫子煎一二沸，倾入盏内，遇咳时温呷三五口，甚妙。【《食疗本草》】
　　止嗽化痰：人参末一两，明矾二两，以酽酢二升熬矾成膏，入参末，炼蜜和收，每以豌豆大一丸放舌下，其嗽即止，痰自消。【《简便方》】
　　肺热咳嗽：沙参半两，水煎服之。 【《易简方》】
　　痰嗽喘急：桔梗一两半为末，用童子小便半升，煎四合，去滓温服。 【《济众方》】
　　久近痰嗽，自胸膈下塞，停饮至于脏腑：用知母、贝母各一两为末，巴豆三十枚，去油研匀。每服一字，用姜三片，二面蘸药，细嚼咽下便睡。次早必泻一行，其嗽立止。壮人乃用之。一方不用巴豆。【《医学集成》】
　　久嗽气急：知母去毛切五钱隔纸炒，杏仁姜水泡去皮尖焙五钱，以水一锺半，煎一锺，食远温服。次以萝卜子、杏仁等分为末，米糊丸服五十丸，姜汤下，以绝病根。【《杂兴方》】[221p]

Chronic cough from lung deficiency: Two taels of ginseng powder, one tael of stir-fried deer antler glue, each dose three qian, mixed with a cup of mint soy sauce soup and a little green onion, boiled briefly, then poured into the cup. When coughing, sip three to five warm mouthfuls; it is very effective.

For stopping cough and resolving phlegm: One tael of ginseng powder, two taels of alum, boil two sheng of strong vinegar until it becomes a paste, mix in the ginseng powder and honey, form small pills the size of a pea, place under the tongue, the cough will stop and phlegm will dissolve.

For cough due to lung heat: Half a tael of sand ginseng, decoct and take.

For cough with phlegm and wheezing: One and a half taels of platycodon ground into powder, mix with half a sheng of young boy’s urine, decoct for four servings, strain and take warm.

For chronic cough with phlegm obstructing the chest: One tael each of anemarrhena and fritillaria, ground into powder, thirty seeds of wild jalap, remove oil and blend thoroughly. Each dose is one character's amount, use three slices of ginger, dip both sides in the powder, chew finely and swallow before sleeping. The next morning, expect one bowel movement; the cough will cease immediately. This is for strong individuals, another method does not use wild jalap.

For chronic cough with breathlessness: Five qian of anemarrhena, hairs removed, cut and stir-fried between paper, five qian of bitter almonds soaked in ginger water to remove skins and tips, roasted. With one and a half bowls of water, boil down to one bowl, take warm far from meals. Then take equal parts of radish seeds and bitter almonds, grind into powder, form into fifty pills with rice paste, take with ginger soup to eliminate the root of the illness.[221p]

　　三焦咳嗽，腹满不饮食，气不顺：仙灵脾、覆盆子、五味子炒各一两为末，炼蜜丸梧子大，每姜茶下二十丸。【《圣济录》】
　　老小欬嗽：延胡索一两，枯矾二钱半为末，每服二钱，软饧一块和含之。
　　化痰降气，止咳解郁，消食除胀，有奇效。用贝母去心一两，姜制厚朴半两，蜜丸梧子大，每白汤下五十丸。【《笔峰方》】
　　久嗽唾血：白前、桔梗、桑白皮三两炒，甘草一两炙，水六升，煮一升，分三服。忌猪肉菘菜。【《外台》】
　　久患呷嗽，喉中作声，不得眠：取白前焙捣为末，每温酒服二钱。 【《深师方》】
　　咳嗽短气：紫苏二钱，人参一钱，水一锺煎服。 【《普济方》】
　　上气咳逆：紫苏子入水研，滤汁同粳米煮粥食。 【《简便方》】[222p]

  • For cough due to Sanjiao with fullness in the abdomen and difficulty in eating, mix equal parts of Xianlingpi, raspberry, and Schisandra, and grind into a powder. Form into pills the size of a walnut with honey, and take twenty pills with ginger tea.
  • For cough in the elderly and children: Take one liang of Corydalis and two and a half qian of burnt alum, grind into a powder, and take two qian mixed with a piece of soft syrup to dissolve in the mouth.
  • To transform phlegm, descend qi, stop coughing, relieve depression, and reduce bloating, use one liang of Fritillaria without the heart, half a liang of ginger-prepared Magnolia bark, and form into pills the size of a walnut. Take fifty pills with clear broth.
  • For a chronic cough with blood in sputum: Fry three liang of White Mustard, Platycodon, and Mulberry Bark; prepare one liang of roasted Licorice, boil with six sheng of water until one sheng remains, and divide into three doses. Avoid pork and vegetables.
  • For a long-standing cough with sound in the throat and inability to sleep: Take roasted White Mustard, grind into a powder, and take two qian with warm wine.
  • For coughing with shortness of breath: Use two qian of Perilla and one qian of Ginseng, decoct in one sheng of water.
  • For cough with reversed qi: Grind Perilla seeds in water, strain the juice, and cook congee with glutinous rice.[222p]

　　痰哮欬嗽：苎根煅存性为末，生豆腐蘸三五钱食，即效。如未痊，以肥猪肉二三斤，蘸食甚妙。【《医学正传》】
　　肺伤咳嗽：紫菀五钱，水一盏，煎七分，温服，日三。 【《易简方》】
　　久嗽不止：紫菀、(艹款)冬花各一两，百部半两，捣罗为末，每服三钱，姜三片，乌梅一个，煎汤调下，日二，甚佳。【《图经》】
　　久嗽不止：每旦取(艹款)冬花如鸡子许，少蜜拌花使润，纳一升铁铛中，又用一瓦盆钻一孔，孔内安一小笔管，以面泥封，勿冷漏气，铛下着炭火，少时烟从筒出，以口含吸咽之。如胸中少闷，须举头，即将指头按住筒口勿使漏，至烟尽乃止。如是五日一为之，待至六日，饱食羊肉馎饦一顿，永瘥。　　又方：病嗽多日，然(艹款)冬花三两于无风处，以笔管吸其烟，满口即咽之，数日效。
　　痰嗽带血：(艹款)冬花、百合蒸焙等分为末，蜜丸龙眼大，每卧时嚼一丸，姜汤下。【《济生方》】[223p]

Sputum cough: Burn the root of ramie and grind it to powder, then dip it in tofu and eat three to five qian; it works immediately. If not healed, eat two to three pounds of fatty pork, dipping it; it is very effective.

Lung injury cough: Five qian of Purple Aster, one cup of water, simmer until reduced to seven parts, take warm three times a day.

Persistent cough: One tael each of Purple Aster and winter flower, half a tael of hundred parts, pound and sieve into powder. Take three qian each time with three slices of ginger and one dried plum, decoct the soup and drink it down, twice a day; it is very good.

Persistent cough: Each morning, take winter flower about the size of a chicken egg, mix with a little honey to moisten, put it in an iron pot, and use a ceramic basin drilled with a small hole to set a small straw inside, sealing it with flour paste, to avoid cold air leakage. Light a charcoal fire under the pot; after a while, smoke will come out of the tube. Inhale the smoke through the mouth and throat. If there is slight discomfort in the chest, lift the head and use a finger to block the tube's opening to prevent leakage, stopping when the smoke is finished. Do this for five days; on the sixth day, have a hearty meal of lamb and dumplings, resulting in a complete cure.

Another recipe: For a cough lasting many days, take three taels of winter flower in a windless place, inhale its smoke through a straw until the mouth is full and swallow; after several days, it works.

Cough with blood in phlegm: Mix equal parts of winter flower and lily, steam and grind into powder, making honey pills the size of longan. Chew one pill each time before lying down, swallowing with ginger soup.[223p]

　　痰饮咳嗽：含奇丸。用葶苈子纸衬炒令黑，知母、贝母各一两为末，枣肉半两，沙糖一两半，和丸弹丸大，每以新绵裹一丸含之咽津，甚者不过三丸。【《箧中方》】
　　咳嗽上气不得卧，或遍体气肿，或单面肿足肿：葶苈子三升，微火熬研，以绢袋盛，浸清酒五升中，冬七日，夏三日。初服如桃许大，日三夜一。冬月日二夜二。量其气力，取微利一次为度。如患急者，不待日满，亦可绞服。【《崔知悌方》】
　　上气咳嗽，呷呀气息，喉中作声，唾粘：以蓝叶水浸捣汁一升，空腹频服，须臾以杏仁研汁煮粥食之，一两日将息，依前法更服，吐痰尽方瘥。【《梅师方》】
　　久嗽不止，有脓血：莨菪子五钱，淘去浮者，煮令芽出，炒研，真酥一鸡子大，大枣七枚同煎，令酥尽取枣，日食三枚。　　又方：莨菪子，三撮吞之，日五六度。光禄李丞服之神验。 【《必效方》】[224p]

Cough from phlegm and fluid: Take Qiyan pills. Use artemisia seed paper to line and roast until black. Grind one tael each of Anemarrhena and Fritillaria; half a tael of jujube meat; one and a half taels of rock sugar. Mix and form into pills the size of a bullet, wrapping each in new cotton to dissolve in saliva. For severe cases, no more than three pills.

Coughing with difficulty breathing, unable to lie down; may have generalized swelling or unilateral swelling of the face and feet: Take three sheng of artemisia seeds, simmer gently and grind, strain into a silk bag, soak in five sheng of clear wine for seven days in winter and three days in summer. Initially, take a dose the size of a peach pit, three times a day and once before bed. In winter, take twice a day and twice before bed. Adjust dosage of air strength; take a small benefit each time. In acute cases, it can be taken before the full soaking period.

Coughing with breathlessness, making sounds in the throat, sticky saliva: Soak and mash blue leaf in water to extract one sheng of juice, taking it on an empty stomach frequently. Soon, mash almonds to extract juice, cooking it into congee for consumption. Rest for one to two days, then continue as before until phlegm is completely expelled.

Coughing that persists, with purulent blood: Take five qian of stramonium seeds, removing floaters, boil until sprouts appear, then roast and grind. Take one egg-sized amount of fine grease and seven dates, boiling until the grease is entirely extracted, consume three dates daily. Another method: Take three pinches of stramonium seeds, swallow them, five to six times a day. It was reported effective by Minister Li of the Court of Rites.[224p]

　　齁喘欬嗽：蓖麻子去壳炒熟，拣甜者食之，须多服见效，终身不可食炒豆。 【《易简方》】
　　卒得欬嗽：芫花一升，水三升，煮汁一升，以枣十四枚煮汁干，日食五枚愈。 【《肘后方》】
　　卒嗽有痰：芫花一两炒，水一升，煮四五沸，去滓，白糖入半斤，每服枣许。勿食酸咸物。
　　喘嗽失音，暴伤寒冷所致：取芫花连根一虎口切暴干，令病人以荐自裹舂，令灰飞扬，入其七孔中，当眼泪出，口鼻皆辣，待芫根尽乃止，病即愈。　　久嗽肺胀：五味二两，粟壳白饧炒过半两为末，白饧丸弹子大，每服一丸，水煎服。 【《卫生家宝方》】
　　久嗽不止：五味子一两，真茶四钱，晒研为末，以甘草五钱煎膏，丸菉豆大，每二十丸，沸汤下，数日即愈。
　　痰嗽并喘：五味子、白矾等分为末，每服三钱，以生猪肺炙蘸末细嚼白汤下。汉阳库兵黄六病此，百药不效，于岳阳遇一道人传此，两服病遂不发。【《普济方》】[225p]

Coughing with wheezing: Roast castor seeds after removing their shells, select sweet ones to consume, take a large quantity to see effects, but never eat roasted beans for life.

For sudden cough: Take one sheng of euphorbia, three sheng of water, boil until the juice is reduced to one sheng, add fourteen jujubes and boil until the juice is concentrated, eat five a day to recover.

For sudden cough with phlegm: Stir-fry one liang of euphorbia, add one sheng of water, boil four to five times, strain, add half a jin of sugar, take a jujube-sized portion each time. Avoid sour and salty foods.

For cough and loss of voice caused by acute cold: Take euphorbia with roots, slice and dry it, have the patient wrap it in cloth and pound it until powder flies up, placing the powder into the seven openings (eyes, nose, etc.), wait until tears flow and nose/mouth feel spicy, stop once the euphorbia is used up, and the illness will be cured.

For prolonged cough with lung distension: Use two liang of the five-flavor fruit and half a liang of white rice husk fried until brown, grind to a powder, form into pill-sized balls, take one pill boiled in water.

For persistent cough: One liang of five-flavor fruit, four qian of genuine tea, sun-dry and grind to a powder, with five qian of licorice boiled into syrup, form into beans-sized pills, take twenty pills with boiling water, recovery will occur in a few days.

For phlegmatic cough with wheezing: Equal parts of five-flavor fruit and alum ground into powder, take three qian each time, chew with roasted pig lung and wash down with white soup. A soldier named Huang Liu from Hanyang had this ailment, and after trying countless remedies without success, he encountered a Daoist in Yueyang who taught him this method, and after two doses, the illness ceased to manifest.[225p]

　　肺虚久嗽：木鳖子、(艹款)冬花各一两为末，每用三钱，焚之吸烟，良久吐涎，以茶润喉，如此五六次后，服补肺药。又方：用木鳖子一个，雄黄一钱。【《圣济方》】
　　痰欬不止：(艹舌)蒌仁一两，文蛤七分为末，以姜汁澄浓脚，丸弹子大，噙之。
　　干咳无痰：熟(艹舌)蒌捣烂绞汁，入蜜等分，加白矾一钱，熬膏，频含咽汁。【《简便方》】
　　欬嗽有痰：熟(艹舌)蒌十个，明矾二两，捣和饼，阴干研末，糊丸梧子大，每姜汤下五七十丸。【《医方摘要》】
　　热咳不止：用浓茶汤一锺，蜜一锺，大熟(艹舌)蒌一个，去皮，将瓤入茶蜜汤洗去子，碗盛，于饭上蒸，至饭熟取出，时时挑三四匙咽之。【《摘元方》】
　　肺热痰咳，胸膈塞满：用(艹舌)蒌仁、半夏汤泡七次焙研各一两，姜汁打面糊丸梧子大，每服五十丸，食后姜汤下。【《济生方》】[226p]

Long-term Lung Deficiency Cough: Grind one tael each of Mu Bie Zi (Momordica fruit) and Dong Hua (Winter Flower) into powder. Each time, use three qian, burn it to inhale the smoke, and after a long while, spit out saliva. Moisten the throat with tea, repeating this five to six times before taking lung tonifying medicine. Another method: use one Mu Bie Zi and one qian of Xiong Huang (realgar).

Persistent Phlegm Cough: Grind one tael of Chen Su (Stropharia) seeds and seven fen of Wen Ge (文蛤) into powder. Use concentrated ginger juice to form paste, make into ball-sized pills, and suck on them.

Dry Cough without Phlegm: Mash cooked Chen Su, strain the juice, mix with equal parts honey, and add one qian of alum. Boil to create a paste, frequently holding it in the mouth to swallow.

Cough with Phlegm: Take ten pieces of cooked Chen Su and two taels of alum, mash and mix into a cake, dry and grind into powder. Form into pills the size of Wuzizi (a type of nut), taking five to seventy pills after a meal with ginger soup.

Persistent Cough with Heat: Use one cup of strong tea, one cup of honey, and one cooked Chen Su without skin. Wash the flesh in the tea and honey mixture, steam it over rice until cooked, and occasionally take three to four spoonfuls to swallow.

Cough with Lung Heat and Blocked Chest: Soak one tael each of Chen Su seeds and Ban Xia in water seven times, then grind. Mix with ginger juice to form paste-sized pills, and take fifty pills after meals with ginger soup.[226p]

　　酒痰欬嗽：(艹舌)蒌仁、青黛等分研末，姜汁蜜丸芡子大，每噙一丸。【丹溪】

　　虚热咳嗽：天花粉一两，人参三钱为末，每服一钱，米汤下。 【《集简方》】
　　卒暴欬嗽：用百部根渍酒，每温服一升，日三服。　　又方：用百部生姜，各捣汁等分，煎服二合。　　又方：用百部藤根捣自然汁，和蜜等分，沸汤煎膏噙咽。　　又方：治卒咳不止，用百部根悬火上炙干，每含咽汁，勿令人知。[227p]

Cough with Phlegm: Grind an equal amount of the root of the plant (with grass radical), and Qingdai into a powder. Make into pills the size of a lotus seed with ginger juice and honey, taking one pill at a time.

Chest Obstruction with Phlegm Cough: Chest pain radiating to the back, fullness in the heart and abdomen, and difficulty in breathing. For treating phlegm cough: Take the mature fruit of the plant (with grass radical), remove the flesh, fry the seeds, and grind the shells into powder. Clear Phlegm and Relieve Cough: For treating cough: Clean large mature fruits of the plant (with grass radical), remove the seeds, cut and roast them. Use the water from the washed plant (with grass radical), boil together with the flesh to make a paste, then roll into pills the size of a walnut, taking 30 to 50 pills with ginger soup; very effective.

Cough from Deficiency Heat: One tael of Tianhua Fen and three qian of ginseng ground into powder; take one qian with rice soup.

　　三十年嗽：百部根二十斤，捣取汁，煎如饴，服方寸匕，日三服。《深师》加蜜二斤，《外台》加饴一斤。【《千金方》】
　　气热咳嗽：石韦、槟榔等分为末，姜汤服二钱。 【《圣济录》】
　　久嗽不止：马勃为末，蜜丸梧子大，每服二十丸，白汤下即愈。 【《普济方》】

　　一切久近欬嗽：百部根切，炒袋盛，浸酒频频饮之。寒痰咳嗽，烧酒四两，猪脂、蜜、香油、茶末各四两，同浸酒内，煮成一处，每日挑食，以茶下之，取效。[228p]

  • For a cough lasting thirty years: Take 20 jin of the root of Baibu, pound to extract juice, and boil until syrupy. Take a piece the size of a thumb daily in three doses. “Shen Shi” adds 2 jin of honey; “Wai Tai” adds 1 jin of syrup. 【“Qian Jin Fang”】

  • For cough with shortness of breath: Mix 4 liang of buckwheat flour, 2 qian of tea powder, 2 liang of fresh honey, and 1 bowl of water, stirring vigorously. Drink it; if breathlessness continues for a while, it should resolve. 【“Ru Men Shi Qin”】

  • For prolonged cough: Remove the fibers from the grain husk, and roast with honey into a powder, taking 5 fen each time with honey water. 【“Wei Shi Fang”】

  • For chronic, weak cough: Use 2.5 liang of poppy husk, remove the stem and membrane, and roast to obtain 1 liang, along with 0.5 liang of dried black plum, ground into powder. Take 2 qian during rest, swallowed with honey water or warm water. 【“Xuan Ming Fang”】

  • For all long-term coughs: Cut Baibu root, fry in a cloth bag and soak in wine, drinking frequently. For cold phlegm cough, use 4 liang of burnt wine, and mix with 4 liang each of pig fat, honey, fragrant oil, and tea powder, soaking in wine, then boiling together. Consume daily by picking out solid food, swallowing with tea for efficacy.[228p]

　　上气痰嗽，喘促，唾脓血：以莱菔子一合，研细煎汤，食上服之。 【《食医心镜》】
　　肺痰欬嗽：莱菔子半斤，淘凈焙干，炒黄为末，以糖和丸芡子大，绵裹含之，咽汁甚妙。【《胜金方》】
　　久嗽痰喘：萝卜子炒、杏仁去皮尖炒，等分，蒸饼丸麻子大，每服三五丸，时时津咽。【《医学集成》】
　　寒热痰嗽初起者：煨姜一块，含咽之。 【《本草衍义》】
　　寒嗽不止：生姜五两，饧半升，火煎熟，食尽愈。段侍御用之有效。 【《必效方》】
　　久患欬噫：生姜汁半合，蜜一匙，煎温呷服，三服愈。 【《外台秘要》】
　　化痰止嗽：丝瓜烧存性为末，枣肉和丸弹子大，每服一丸，温酒化下。
　　咳嗽寒热，旦夕加重，少喜多嗔，面色不润，忽进忽退，积渐少食，脉弦紧者：杏仁半斤去皮尖，童子小便浸七日，漉出温水淘洗，沙盆内研如泥，以小便三升煎如膏，每服一钱，熟水下。妇人室女服之尤妙。【《千金方》，下同】[229p]

For coughing with phlegm, asthma, and spitting purulent blood: Take one portion of radish seeds, grind finely and decoct, then take it orally.

For lung phlegm cough: Half a pound of radish seeds, wash clean, dry fry until yellow and grind to a powder, mix with sugar to form pills the size of a chestnut, wrap in cotton and suck, swallowing the juice is very effective.

For chronic cough with phlegm and wheezing: Fried radish seeds and peeled fried almonds in equal parts, steam to form balls the size of hemp seeds, take three to five balls at a time, swallowing saliva occasionally.

For cough with cold and heat when first onset: Steep a piece of ginger and suck it down.

For uncontrollable cold cough: Five ounces of fresh ginger, half a sheng of syrup, boil until cooked, eat it all to recover. Effective for Duke Duan.

For prolonged cough and hiccup: Half a cup of ginger juice, one spoonful of honey, decoct warm and drink; three doses to recover.

For resolving phlegm and stopping cough: Burn loofah until charred and grind to powder, mix with jujube flesh and form pills the size of a pellet, take one pill with warm wine.

For cough with cold and heat, worsening morning and night, little joy and much anger, facial color not bright, sudden fluctuations in appetite, gradually less food, tense and wiry pulse: Use half a pound of peeled almonds, soak in young boy's urine for seven days, strain, wash with warm water, grind in a sand basin until it becomes a paste, decoct three sheng in the urine until it becomes thick. Take one qian with warm cooked water. Especially effective for women and virgins.[229p]

　　咳逆上气：不拘大人小儿，以杏仁三升去皮尖炒黄研膏，入蜜一升杵熟，每食前含之咽汁。
　　喉痹痰嗽，喉热生疮，或卒失音声：杏仁去皮熬黄三分，和桂末一分，研泥绵裹含之咽汁。
　　上气咳嗽，胸满气喘：桃仁三两，去皮尖，以水一大升研汁，合粳米二合，煮粥食之。【《心镜》】
　　卒得欬嗽：桃仁三升去皮，杵着器中，密封蒸熟，日干，绢袋浸盛二斗酒中，七日可饮，日饮四五合。
　　急劳咳嗽烦热：用桃仁三两去皮尖，猪肝一枚，童子小便五升，同煮干，于木臼内捣烂，入蒸饼，和丸梧子大，每温水下二十丸。【《圣惠方》，下同】
　　上气咳嗽：用枣二十枚去核，以酥四两，微火煎，入枣肉中，以酥尽取收之。常含一枚，微微咽之，取瘥。[230p]

Cough with reverse qi: Regardless of whether it's an adult or child, take three sheng of peeled apricot kernels, fry them until yellow, grind into a paste, mix with one sheng of honey, and hold in the mouth to swallow the juice before meals.

Throat obstruction with phlegm and cough, throat heat causing sores, or sudden loss of voice: Take three fen of peeled apricot kernels, simmer until yellow, mix with one fen of ground cinnamon, grind into a paste, wrap in cotton, hold in the mouth to swallow the juice.

Cough with upper qi obstruction, chest fullness, and shortness of breath: Take six liang of peach kernels, peeled, with one large sheng of water to grind the juice, mix with two he of polished rice, and cook into porridge to eat.

For sudden cough: Take three sheng of peeled peach kernels, crush them in a container, seal tightly, and steam until cooked. Dry in the sun, then soak in two dou of wine in a silk bag for seven days, and drink four to five he daily.

Urgent labor cough with heat and discomfort: Use three liang of peeled peach kernels, one pig liver, and five sheng of a child's urine. Boil until dry, then mash in a wooden mortar, mix into steamed cakes, and make pills the size of a walnut. Take twenty pills with warm water.

For cough with upper qi obstruction: Take twenty jujubes, remove the pits, fry with four liang of lard over low heat, incorporate the jujube flesh, and collect the fat. Frequently hold one in the mouth, swallow slightly for recovery.[230p]

　　卒得欬嗽：崔元亮海上方，用好梨去核捣汁一碗，入椒四十粒，煎一沸，去滓，纳黑饧一大两，消讫，细细含咽，立定。　　又方：用梨一颗，刺五十孔，每孔纳椒一粒，面裹炭火煨熟，停冷，去椒食之。　　又方：梨一颗去核，纳酥蜜，面裹烧熟，冷食。　　又方：梨一颗切片，酥煎食之。
　　又方：梨捣汁一升，入酥蜜各一两，地黄汁一升，煎膏含咽。凡治嗽须喘息定时冷食之。若热食反伤肺，令嗽更剧，不可救也。若反，可作羊肉汤饼饱食之，佳。
　　经年气嗽：橘皮、神曲、生姜焙干等分为末，蒸饼和丸梧子大，每服三五十丸，食后夜卧各一服。有人患此服之，兼旧患膀胱气皆愈也。【《寇氏衍义》】
　　痰气咳嗽：用香橼去核，切，砂瓶内酒浸，封固一夜，煮烂蜜拌匀，含食之。
　　寒嗽痰喘：白果七个煨熟，以熟艾作七丸，每果入艾一丸，纸包再煨香，去艾吃。 【《秘韫方》】[231p]

Sudden cough: Cui Yuanliang, while at sea, used a good pear, cored and mashed to extract a bowl of juice, adding forty pepper grains, boiling once, straining, and mixing in one large liang of black syrup. After dissolving, it should be taken slowly, holding in the mouth before swallowing, and then remains settled.

Another method: Take one pear, prick it fifty times, put one pepper grain in each hole, wrap it in flour, and roast until cooked. Let it cool, then remove the peppers and eat it.

Another method: Take one pear, core it, fill it with honey, wrap in flour, roast it until cooked, and then eat it cold.

Another method: Take one pear, slice it, and pan-fry it until tender.

Another method: Extract one sheng (approximately 1 liter) of pear juice, add one liang of honey and one liang of prepared Rehmannia juice, and boil down to a paste to hold in the mouth and swallow. In treating coughs, one should take it cold at set intervals. If eaten hot, it may harm the lungs and worsen the cough, leading to irreparable damage. If this occurs, one can eat lamb soup buns to restore strength, which is effective.

For chronic cough: Dried tangerine peel, new wine yeast, and ginger should all be powdered and mixed equally. Steamed into dough balls the size of walnuts, take three to fifty of these after meals and before bed. Some have reported healing from this ailment as well as from longstanding bladder issues.

For phlegm cough: Take a seedless citron, cut it, soak it in wine in a sealed jar overnight, then mash it and mix well with honey to eat.

For cold cough with phlegm: Take seven ginkgo nuts, cook them, and then make seven balls with prepared mugwort. Place one ginkgo nut in each ball, wrap in paper, and steam to scent; then eat the nut after removing the mugwort.[231p]

　　哮喘痰嗽：用银杏五个，麻黄二钱半，甘草炙二钱，水一锺半，煎八分，卧时服。
　　欬嗽失音：白果仁四两，白茯苓、桑白皮各二两，乌豆半升，沙蜜半斤，煮熟，日干为末，以乳汁半碗拌湿，九蒸九晒，丸如菉豆大，每服三五十丸，白汤下，神效。【金居士方】
　　痰喘欬嗽：胡桃肉三颗，生姜三片，卧时嚼服。　　又方：人参寸许，胡桃肉三枚，胡桃须连皮煎汤，服之即愈。
　　久嗽不止：核桃仁五十个，煮熟去皮，人参五两，杏仁三百五十个，麸炒汤浸，去皮研匀，入炼蜜，丸梧子大，每空心细嚼一丸，人参汤临卧再服。
　　肺燥欬嗽：用松子仁一两，胡桃仁二两，研膏和熟蜜半两收之，每服二钱，食后沸汤点服。【《外台秘要》】
　　痰喘咳嗽，不能睡卧：好茶、白僵蚕各一两为末，放碗内盖定，倾沸汤一小盏，临卧再添汤，点服。【《瑞竹堂方》】[232p]

Asthma with cough: Use five ginkgo nuts, two and a half qian of ephedra, two qian of honey-fried licorice, and one and a half sheng of water. Boil to eight parts, and take before lying down.

Cough with loss of voice: Use four liang of ginkgo seeds, two liang each of white poria and mulberry bark, half sheng of black beans, and half jin of sand honey. Cook thoroughly, dry in the sun to make powder, mix with half a bowl of milk to dampen, steam nine times and sun-dry nine times, form into pills the size of a mung bean. Take three to fifty pills with warm water for effective results. [From the Jin Jushi Prescriptions]

Phlegm asthma cough: Chew and take three walnut kernels and three slices of fresh ginger before lying down. Another formula: about an inch of ginseng, three walnut kernels, and walnut husks boiled together into a soup, taking it will lead to recovery.

Persistent cough: Use fifty walnut kernels, boiled and peeled, five liang of ginseng, three hundred and fifty almonds, soaked in broth from roasted wheat bran, peeled, ground well, and mixed with refined honey to form pills the size of a wutong seed. Chew one pill finely on an empty stomach, and take ginseng soup again before lying down.

Dry lung cough: Use one liang of pine nuts, two liang of walnut kernels, grind into a paste and mix with half liang of cooked honey. Take two qian after meals, with hot water to swallow. [From the Wai Tai Mi Yao]

Cough with phlegm asthma, unable to sleep: Use one liang each of good tea and white silkworms, grind to powder, place in a bowl and cover tightly. Pour in a small cup of boiling water before lying down, and add more soup to take. [From the Ruizhu Tang Prescriptions][232p]

　　虚热咳嗽，口干涕唾：用甘蔗汁一升半，青粱米四合，煮粥，日食二次，极润心肺。 【董氏方】
　　上气喘嗽，烦热，食即吐逆：用沙糖、姜汁等分相和，慢煎二十沸，每咽半匙，取效。
　　肺壅痰滞，上焦不利，卒然咳嗽：杉木屑一两，皂角去皮酥炙三两为末，蜜丸梧子大，每米饮下十丸，一日四服。【《圣惠方》】
　　上气咳嗽，腹满羸瘦者：楸叶三斗，水三升，煮三十沸，去滓，煎至可丸，丸如枣大，以筒纳下部中，立愈。【《海上方》】
　　咳逆上气，唾浊不得卧：用皂荚炙去皮子研末，蜜丸梧子大，每服一丸，枣膏汤下，日三夜一服。【仲景】
　　痰喘欬嗽：长皂荚三条去皮子，一荚入巴豆十粒，一荚入半夏十粒，一荚入杏仁十粒，用姜汁制杏仁，麻油制巴豆，蜜制半夏，一处火炙黄色为未，每用一字安手心，临卧以姜汁调之，吃下，神效。【《选奇方》】
　　卒寒欬嗽：皂荚烧研，豉汤服二钱。 【《千金方》】[233p]

  • For dry cough due to internal heat, with dry mouth and throat: Use one and a half liters of sugarcane juice and four quarts of millet, boil together to make porridge, and consume twice a day to greatly nourish the heart and lungs.

  • For wheezing cough with restlessness and vomiting after eating: Mix sweetness and ginger juice in equal parts, simmer slowly for twenty boils, and take half a spoonful each time to achieve effect.

  • For phlegm obstruction in the lungs and sudden cough: Use one tael of cedar wood shavings and three taels of peeled and roasted soap pod ground to a powder, form into honey pills the size of a walnut, consume ten pills with rice wine, four times a day.

  • For wheezing cough and abdominal bloating with weight loss: Use three buckets of catalpa leaves, three liters of water, boil for thirty boils, strain it, reduce it until it can be formed into pills the size of jujubes, and ingest by inserting into the lower body for immediate recovery.

  • For ascending cough and phlegm, causing difficulty sleeping: Use roasted soap pod without seeds ground into powder, form into honey pills the size of a walnut, take one pill with jujube syrup, three times during the day and once at night.

  • For phlegm-induced wheezing cough: Use three long soap pods without seeds, one pod contains ten seeds of bitter bean, one pod contains ten seeds of pinellia, and one pod contains ten almonds. Use ginger juice for almonds, sesame oil for bitter beans, honey for pinellia, and roast them until they are yellow. Use one character’s worth in the palm before sleeping, mix with ginger juice to consume, and it is remarkably effective.

  • For sudden cold-induced cough: Grind the soap pod, and take two qian with fermented soybean soup.[233p]

　　气嗽日久：生诃黎勒一枚，含之咽汁，瘥后，口爽不和，食味却无，槟榔汤一碗服之，立便有味。
　　久嗽欲死：用厚榆皮削如指大，长尺余，纳喉中，频出入，当吐脓血而愈。
　　十年咳嗽，或二十年医不效者：生龟三枚，治如食法。去肠，以水五升，煮取三升，浸曲酿秫米四升，如常饮之，令尽，永不发。　　又方：用生龟一枚，着坎中，令人溺之，浸至三日，烧研。以醇酒一升，和末如干饭，顿服，须臾大吐，嗽囊出则愈。小儿减半。
　　痰饮咳嗽：用真蚌粉新瓦炒红，入青黛少许，用淡虀水滴麻油数点，调服二钱。
　　上气咳嗽：猪肪四两，煮百沸以来，切和酱酢食之。 【《心镜》】
　　二十年嗽：猪(月臣)三具，大枣百枚，酒五升渍之，秋冬七日、春夏五日，绞去滓，七日服尽。忌盐。
　　卒得欬嗽：猪肾二枚，干姜三两，水七升，煮二升，稍服取汗。 【《张文仲方》】[234p]

For chronic cough: Take one piece of fresh Heliotrope, hold it in the mouth and swallow the juice; after recovery, the mouth will feel fresh, but the taste of food will not be pleasant. Drinking a bowl of betel nut decoction will immediately restore taste.

For a cough that makes one feel near death: Use thick elm bark, shaved to the size of a finger and over a foot long; insert it into the throat and repeatedly pull it in and out, which will cause sputum and blood to be expelled, leading to recovery.

For a cough lasting ten to twenty years without responding to treatment: Take three live turtles, prepare them as if cooking food. Remove the intestines, add five liters of water, boil down to three liters, then soak four liters of fermented glutinous rice as usual and drink it all; this will prevent recurrence.

Additionally: Use one live turtle, place it in a basin, let someone urinate on it for three days, then boil and grind it. Mix the powder with one liter of good wine and take it in one sitting; a moment later, one will expel phlegm and recover. For children, reduce the amount by half.

For phlegm and cough: Use genuine clam powder, stir-fried in a new tile until red, then add a little indigo, and mix with thin salt water and a few drops of sesame oil; take two qian (a measure).

For upper respiratory cough: Take four taels of pig fat, boil until bubbling, then eat it mixed with soy sauce and vinegar.

For a cough lasting twenty years: Take three pigs (referring to a reference term), one hundred jujubes, and soak them in five liters of wine; for autumn and winter, soak for seven days; for spring and summer, soak for five days. Strain and drink within seven days. Avoid salt.

For sudden cough: Take two pig kidneys, three taels of dried ginger, and seven liters of water; boil down to two liters and take small amounts to induce sweating.[234p]

　　久嗽不瘥：猪肾二枚，入椒四七粒，水煮啖之。
　　喘嗽面浮，并四肢浮者：蛤蚧一雌一雄，头尾全者，法酒和蜜涂之，炙熟，紫团人参似人形者半两为末，化蜡和四两作六饼，每煮糯米薄粥一盏，投入一饼搅化，细细热呷之。【《普济方》】
　　治嗽方甚多，余得一方甚简，但用香橼去核，薄切作细片，以时酒同入砂瓶内，煮令熟烂，自昏至五更为度，用蜜拌匀，当睡中唤起，用匙挑服，甚效。
